tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]]) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Here "in Yahweh" refers to what Yahweh has done for them. "Rejoice because of what Yahweh has done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: praise is appropriate for the upright
tn.text: "to praise Yahweh is appropriate for upright people"
Each verse consists of two lines that have very similar meanings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Here "upright" is used as a metaphor for something that is true. AT: "Yahweh always does what he says that he will do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These abstract nouns can be stated as actions. AT: "He loves doing what is right and just" or "He loves those who do what is right and just" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: The earth is full of Yahweh's covenant faithfulness
tn.text: Here "The earth is full" is an idiom that means his covenant faithfulness can be see all over the earth. AT: "Yahweh's covenant faithfulness can be experienced all over the world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: By the word of Yahweh the heavens were made
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "By using his word, Yahweh made the heavens" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: by the breath of his mouth
tn.text: This refers to Yahweh's word. AT: "by his word" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Each verse consists of two lines that have very similar meanings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"like behind a dam." The writer describes the creation of the sea as if God piles up all the waters together. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: he puts the oceans in storehouses
tn.text: The writer describes the creation of the oceans as if God put them in a storehouse. AT: "he puts the oceans in their place, just like a man puts grain in a storehouse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to the people on the earth. AT: "Let everyone on earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "stand in awe" is an idiom that means "be in awe." AT: "honor him" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here "stood in place" is an idiom that means "was created." AT: "started to exist" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Each verse consists of two lines that have very similar meanings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"Yahweh destroys" or "Yahweh breaks"
Here "nations" refers to the people of these nations. AT: "the alliances of the people of different nations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
An alliance is an agreement between two or more nations to support each other in a war against a common enemy.
"the intentions of the peoples" AT: "the evil plans of the peoples"
Here "stand" is an idiom that means "endure." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the plans of his heart for all generations
tn.text: The missing term "stand" is implied. AT: "the plans of his heart stand for all generations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Here "his heart" refers to Yahweh. AT: "his plans" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"for all future generations." This is an idiom that means "forever." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here "the nation" refers to the people of the nation. AT: "Blessed are the people of the nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"who worship Yahweh as God"
The people Yahweh has chosen to worship him are described here as if they were an inheritance that he has received. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The place where Yahweh lives is spoken of as if it is above the earth where people live. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: shapes the hearts of them all
tn.text: Here "hearts" refers to the thinking of these people. The writer speaks of Yahweh guiding the thinking of the people as if he were a potter who was shaping a bowl. AT: "guides their thinking as a potter shapes a bowl" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: No king is saved by a vast army
tn.text: This could be stated in active form. AT: "A large army is not what saves a king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "a horse" represents the strongest part of the army. AT: "Having an army with strong horses does not provide security" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This word shows that a new theme begins in this Psalm. AT: "Look" or "Listen" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you"
Here "eye" refers to Yahweh's attention. AT: "Yahweh's attention" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"who wait for" or "who hope for"

tn.ref: to deliver their lives from death
tn.text: Here "their lives" refers to the people. AT: "to keep them from dying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "wait" is an idiom that refers to trust. AT: "We trust in Yahweh" (UDB) or "We hope in Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: he is our help and our shield
tn.text: Here Yahweh is spoken of as if he is a shield that protects soldiers in battle. AT: "he is our helper and protects us like a shield" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "hearts" refer to the people. AT: "We rejoice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "holy name" refers to Yahweh's holy character. AT: "in his holy character" or "in him because he is holy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This idiom means "help us." AT: "work for our good" or "help us" or "protect us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: as we put our hope in you
tn.text: "as we hope for your help"
